name: Fundfi
desc: Revenue-based financing, MCAs, traditional loans, and credit splits across US + Canada. Founded 2020. Expanded credit facility TWICE in 2025. Launched two new products (loans + credit splits) Dec 2025. Active cross-border financing amid US-Canada tariff dynamics.

leaders.bg: Indiana Univ Kelley School of Business (Finance). Leading rapid North American expansion with 2x facility expansion + 2 new products in 2025.
Pace Univ MBA. Previously CIO at Radlett Capital (alt investments). Former CEO of Dillon Strategic Solutions.

name: FundKite
desc: Leading fintech MCA funder. $70M revenue, 50-90 employees, $900M+ funded to 200K+ businesses. Alex Shvarts personally coded proprietary daily reconciliation platform. COO Rick Kuci is former CEO of Grove Bank & Trust. Forbes Tech Council member. Just launched manufacturing-specific loans (Jan 2026).

leaders.bg: 30+ yrs building businesses. Personally coded FundKite platform. Forbes Technology Council (2019). Talk tech-to-tech.
Former Chairman/CEO of Grove Bank & Trust. Promoted Sep 2023. Brings banking rigor to fintech speed.
Decade+ in fintech. Manages ISO/broker channel. Speed-to-approval is his competitive weapon.
CUNY Brooklyn College. Manages capital deployment and risk.

name: Vox Funding
desc: NYC-based MCA funder established in 2018. Just closed a $150M credit facility with Raven Capital. 11-50 employees. CEO Adam Benowitz led the deal. Louis Calderone (President/Co-Founder) is speaking on the Funder Panel.

leaders.bg: UC Berkeley. Former trader, co-founded Vision Capital Advisors (150+ portfolio cos). Led $150M Raven Capital facility.
Hofstra Univ. 25+ yrs exp. Former President at Aegis Capital Corp. Speaking on Funder Panel.
Leads tech, data analytics, and marketing. Primary technology buyer.
Oversees financial operations. Focused on ROI and portfolio performance.
Oversees legal and compliance for VOX alternative financing operations.

name: CAN Capital
desc: Pioneer of the MCA industry, founded 1998. Over $8B in total capital deployed to 85K+ merchants. CEO Ed Siciliano (prev Marlin Business Services COO). Completed 2-year tech modernization in 2023 including cloud migration.

leaders.bg: Rutgers. 30+ yrs in commercial financing. Prev COO/Interim CEO at Marlin Business Services, drove 5x origination growth.
Rutgers Business School. 30 yrs in finance. Appointed CFO Oct 2023.
At CAN Capital 20+ years since 2003. Manages ISO/broker partner program.
Columbia Univ. Previously at Capgemini (Banking & Capital Markets), Kapitus.
UVA. Previously at Marlin Capital Solutions and Direct Capital/CIT Bank.

name: Elevate Funding
desc: True direct funder in Revenue-Based Finance (MCA) since 2015, Gainesville FL. Founded by Heather Francis (CEO). ~20 employees. Already investing in deepfake detection tech and compliance monitoring (PerformLine). Launched proprietary merchant portal "Elevate View." Featured in American Banker for fr

leaders.bg: UF grad. In MCA since 2009. Previously EVP at Merchant Cash Group. YEC member. Already investing in deepfake detection and compliance tech.
UF Business Management. At Elevate since 2015. Featured in FunderIntel interview. Also runs Ken Eats Gainesville food blog.
Rose through ranks at Elevate from Underwriter to Senior to Manager. Deep knowledge of risk criteria and deal evaluation.
Joined Feb 2025. New hire indicates growing underwriting capacity.

name: Velocity Capital Group
desc: Cedarhurst, NY MCA funder. Same-day funding up to $1M. $50M Arena Investors facility. 40K+ broker relationships. Jay has $850M+ career sales over 13 years. Hired CRO Jesse Guzman (Aug 2024, ex-Nexi). Attending dinner roundtable.

leaders.bg: Touro University. 13-year MCA career, $850M+ in sales. 40K+ broker relationships. Focused on cost-per-funded-deal economics.
Hired Aug 2024 from Nexi. University of Maryland. Brought in to scale revenue operations.
Drexel University. Previously at Swift Financial and Legend Advance Funding. Drives BD.
EY and RSM US background in accounting and risk. Oversees risk assessment and portfolio quality.
Baruch College. Digital marketing background. Leads brand and growth.

name: Rapid Finance
desc: Bethesda, MD full-service lender (est. 2005). $4.5B+ total financing. 200+ employees. MCAs, term loans, LOC, SBA. CEO Will Tumulty is ex-Navy SEAL, Stanford MBA. CAUTION: Launched SPADE AI tool (June 2025) that cuts doc processing from 20 min to 20 sec. Also launched integrated LOS for community ban

leaders.bg: Former Navy SEAL. Stanford MBA. Previously at Capital One and AccountNow. Leads with discipline and operational excellence.
16+ years at Rapid. Georgetown Univ. Ex-Morgan Stanley. Deeply embedded in the business.
CPA. Duke economics. Co-founded Rapid in 2005. Board-level decision maker.
20+ years credit risk. Ex-Capital One. UVA economics. THE buyer for underwriting tech.
Built Lynx and SPADE platforms. CS from UMD. Founded 2 tech ventures. Technical decision-maker.

name: Forward Financing
desc: Boston fintech (est. 2012). $4.3B+ total funding. $620M in credit facilities. New CEO Jason Mullins (Jan 2025, ex-CEO goeasy Ltd Canada). $170M inaugural securitization (Dec 2025, 2x oversubscribed). New CRO Tyler Thielmann (July 2025). Already uses TensorFlow/DataRobot. 5 Built In 2026 awards. Posi

leaders.bg: Appointed Jan 2025. Ex-CEO of goeasy Ltd (Canada). Seeking quick wins to prove impact. New leader = open to new tech.
12 years as CEO before transitioning. Ex-UBS Investment Bank. Boston College. Built the company.
Appointed July 2025. Founding team at Spring Financial (scaled to 1M applicants/yr). Revenue-focused.
Ex-Goldman Sachs. Kellogg MBA. Oversees risk/analytics with TensorFlow/DataRobot. Technical buyer.
25+ years. Built ODX lending SaaS at OnDeck. Ex-Amount CTO. Deep lending tech expertise.

name: idea Financial
desc: Miami-based non-bank LOC/term loan provider (est. 2017). Surpassed $1B funded, 10K+ businesses. $20M EverBank term loan (Jan 2026). $50M warehouse facility (Oct 2024). Founded by two trial lawyers. Expanding into legal lending (case financing for law firms).

leaders.bg: Trial lawyer turned CEO. $11.1M malpractice verdict. UM Law JD cum laude. Values efficiency and data-driven decisions.
Commercial litigator. UF law degree. Handles operations/strategy. Values compliance and risk management.
Previously CSO at UpWise. ICE trading floor background. Manages operational metrics.
Rose from entry-level during COVID to overseeing all sales/marketing. Featured in deBanked Nov 2025. Face-to-face networker.

name: Spartan Capital
desc: Middletown, NY MCA/revenue-based funder (est. 2015). $10M+/month originations. Bootstrapped with no VC funding. Rapidly building C-suite: CFO Terence Walsh (Apr 2025, ex-Fora Financial), Dir Underwriting Connor Leppzer (May 2025, ex-Forward Financing). Launched Texas installment loan product (Aug 20

leaders.bg: NJIT BS, NYU MBA. Bootstrapped to $10M+/month. No external funding. Capital-efficient operator.
Appointed Apr 2025. Ex-CFO Hugo Insurance. Ex-VP Finance Fora Financial ($1B+ originated). Understands unit economics.
Appointed May 2025. Ex-Forward Financing underwriting manager. Data-driven. Has evaluated AI tools before. THE buyer.
NYC metro area. Manages broker/ISO relationships and sales organization.
Drexel University. Leads brand and growth strategy. Represented Spartan at Broker Fair 2025.

name: CapFlow Funding Group
desc: Private commercial lender (est. 2009) in NJ. Specializes in factoring, AR, inventory, PO funding. $1B+ working capital provided. Sister company to CFG Merchant Solutions (same founders: Andrew Coon, Bill Gallagher). New FactorLOC product (Sep 2024). Thomas Ingrassia hired as CRO (2024, ex-Goldman Sa

leaders.bg: Also CEO of CFG Merchant Solutions. Brown Univ BA, WashU MBA. 30+ yrs. Ex-Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch, S&P. Sell to one = sell to both.
Hired 2024 to optimize FactorLOC. 17+ yrs in factoring. Ex-Goldman Sachs Prime Brokerage. Ex-VP at Capstone (15 yrs). THE buyer.
IFA NEXGEN Rookie of the Year. At CapFlow since Oct 2022. Hungry for tools that give him a competitive edge.
CFO of both CapFlow and CFG Merchant Solutions. Forbes Finance Council member. Controls the purse strings.
CIO of both CapFlow and CFGMS. Ex-CEO AllTrust Networks, ex-COO Treater. Tech decision-maker for both entities.

name: CFG Merchant Solutions
desc: NYC direct MCA funder (est. 2015). $2B+ total funded. 50-200 employees. Great Place to Work 2024-2025. $145M credit facility (May 2024). $500M+ through ISOs in 2024. Launched Texas fixed-term loan (Aug 2025). CA SB 362 compliant. Sister company to CapFlow. Forbes Business Council members. Congressio

leaders.bg: Also CEO of CapFlow. Brown Univ BA, WashU MBA. 30+ yrs. Ex-Morgan Stanley, Merrill Lynch, S&P. Most institutional background in MCA.
25+ yrs. Villanova economics. Ex-Lehman Brothers (13 yrs), Barclays Capital, Hudson Castle. Forbes Business Council. Former CCO at CapFlow.
CFO since 2015. Forbes Finance Council member. Understands unit economics deeply.
Ex-CEO AllTrust Networks. Ex-COO Treater. Specialist in launching tech-driven businesses. Technical decision-maker.
Ex-Bloomberg LP (Team Leader). Daily user of underwriting tools. Demo the product to him for endorsement.

name: Lendini
desc: Analytics-driven fintech (parent: Funding Metrics LLC, est. 2014). Bensalem, PA. Proprietary risk models + real-time cash flow data. $500M+ funded to 9,500+ businesses. $100M revolving credit facility. Also operates QuickFix Capital. Has Sr. Data Scientist on staff (Domenico Frascella).

leaders.bg: Founded Funding Metrics 2013. Built proprietary risk models and online platform. Analytics-first approach.
Runs day-to-day operations alongside Frascella. Key operational decision-maker.
Works on proprietary risk models and analytics. Technical decision-influencer. Deep ML/data pipeline conversation.
Manages ISO relationships. Pitch faster approvals through AI for her ISO partners.

name: Dynamic Capital
desc: Miami-based direct MCA funder (est. 2013). ~84 employees, $7.9M revenue, 64% headcount growth last year. Handles everything from underwriting to funding in-house. Secured $55M debt facility from Mitsubishi HC Capital America (Jul 2023). Offers MCAs, working capital, LOC, revenue-based financing up t

leaders.bg: University of South Florida. Founded Dynamic Capital in 2013. Handles both strategy and operations. Known for training zero-experience hires into full-cycle funding professionals. DeBanked panelist.

name: Tip Top Capital
desc: NYC-based MCA funder and alternative lender (est. 2016). Offers MCAs, working capital, LOC, and asset-based loans. Chairman Vinnie Rodriguez has personally arranged $400M+ in funding since 2018. Notably expanding into conventional/term lending (Rodriguez holds dual title of Chairman & Director of Co

leaders.bg: Wentworth Institute of Technology. Founded Tip Top Capital ~2016. Personally arranged $400M+ in funding. Leading strategic expansion into conventional lending products. DeBanked panelist.

name: Lexington Capital Holdings
desc: Long Island-based alternative financing brokerage/ISO (est. ~2022). ~60 employees (avg age ~25), making it one of the fastest-growing brokerages in the space. CEO Frankie DiAntonio is ~26 years old with MBA from Stony Brook. Broker, not direct funder — maintains relationships with dozens of lenders.

leaders.bg: ~26 years old. MBA from Stony Brook University. Lifelong serial entrepreneur. Profiled by CFO.com. Founded The Lexington Foundation. DeBanked panelist.

name: World Business Lenders
desc: Direct lender specializing in real estate-secured short-term business loans (est. 2011). Elmsford, NY. 300+ employees. ~$37.8M revenue. Loans $5K-$2M, 3-24 months, 13%+ rates. All loans collateralized by real property. Founded by Doug Naidus (ex-Deutsche Bank MD, founded MortgageIT → NYSE IPO → sold

leaders.bg: 28+ yrs financial services. Founded MortgageIT (NYSE IPO, sold to Deutsche Bank 2007). Previously Deutsche Bank MD.
Oversees Processing, Valuation, Underwriting, and Closing. 12+ yrs RE investing. Joined 2021. KEY BUYER.
30+ years financial services. Legal and compliance oversight.
Manages referral partner relations and originations. 20+ years sales. Joined 2013.
Senior operational leadership. Oversees administration.

name: Credibly
desc: Formerly Retail Capital (rebranded 2016). Southfield, MI fintech lender offering working capital, MCAs, lines of credit, and SBA loans to SMBs. ~180 employees, ~$61.8M revenue. $3B+ total capital deployed to 60K+ small businesses. Management buyout Aug 2023. Launched Credibly.ai (Apr 2025) showcasin

leaders.bg: Co-leads Credibly. Drove growth from startup to $3B+ deployed. Strategic vision and partnerships.
Co-leads Credibly alongside Rosett. Operational leadership through management buyout and scaling.
Leads technology and engineering. Key decision-maker for AI/tech integrations like HyperVerge.
Oversees financial strategy. Important for ROI-based conversations about technology investments.
Chief Strategy Officer. Drives strategic initiatives including the Credibly.ai innovation platform.

name: BHG Financial
desc: Leading fintech lender originating over $23B in loans since 2001, primarily serving professionals (healthcare, legal, accounting) with high-quality consumer and business loans distributed through an institutional network of 1,650+ banks.

leaders.bg: Co-founded BHG Financial in 2001 with $25K in capital; 40+ years of sales, management, and leadership experience in financial services.
Leads business development, placement operations, bank marketing, national events, and regulatory relations at BHG Financial.
Responsible for safeguarding BHG Financial's interests and reputation by managing and mitigating business risks.

name: Biz2Credit (Itria Ventures)
desc: Leading fintech platform for small business lending and digital lending infrastructure (Biz2X), managing billions in active loans with $100M+ ARR, serving both direct borrowers and powering lending-as-a-service for banks and financial institutions.

leaders.bg: Built Biz2Credit into a dual-engine empire with billions in active loans and $100M+ ARR; IPO planned for early 2027.
Heads credit and sales operations with 10+ years of financial services experience at Citibank and Xerox.
Driving Biz2Credit's next growth stage in embedded finance, modern lending, and AI-powered fintech.

name: CapitaLand Group
desc: eCapital Corp is a specialty finance lender providing factoring, asset-based lending, and working capital solutions across the US, Canada, and UK, with 850+ employees and $36B+ in cumulative financing through aggressive acquisition-driven growth.

leaders.bg: Over 20 years in structured finance, syndication, and M&A; led eCapital through numerous acquisitions growing to 850+ employees.
Appointed in March 2025 to lead eCapital's growing commercial finance division.
Appointed September 2025; nearly 20 years of experience driving technology transformation in asset-backed finance and private credit.

name: OnDeck
desc: Pioneering online small business lender (now a subsidiary of Enova International) that has provided $15B+ in loans, offering term loans and lines of credit to SMBs through a technology-driven platform.

leaders.bg: Longtime CEO of Enova; transitioning to Executive Chairman effective January 2026 after leading the OnDeck acquisition and integration.
Current CFO succeeding Fisher as CEO in Jan 2026; previously EVP and Chief Risk Officer at Discover Financial Services.
Former OnDeck COO and General Counsel who now co-leads the Enova Small Business division.

name: Ascentium Capital
desc: A division of Regions Bank providing nationwide equipment and technology financing, having funded over $14.1B since 2011 with a focus on streamlined financing for specialized business equipment, commercial vehicles, and small-business needs.

leaders.bg: Elevated to lead Ascentium Capital in 2025, succeeding founder Tom Depping who retired after 40 years in equipment finance.
Founded Ascentium Capital in 2011 and led it for over a decade before retiring in 2025 after a 40-year career in equipment finance.

name: Drip Capital
desc: Fintech company providing trade finance solutions for cross-border SME exporters and importers, backed by $50M from TD Bank, profitable, and recognized as a leading soonicorn in India's fintech space.

leaders.bg: Responsible for strategic direction, product, business development and operations; led Drip Capital to profitability and secured $50M credit facility from TD Bank.
Co-founded Drip Capital to simplify trade finance for cross-border SMEs.

name: iBusiness Funding
desc: Leading SBA lending technology company offering LenderAI software and Lending-as-a-Service (LaaS) platform, processing 1,000+ daily loan applications and partnering with Intuit QuickBooks for small business loan origination.

leaders.bg: Founded Knight Capital Funding in 2013, frustrated by industry inefficiencies; built LenderAI to transform commercial lending through AI chatbots and automation.
Leads the Lending-as-a-Service division, helping banks and lenders streamline their SBA lending operations.

name: Balboa Capital
desc: Equipment finance and small business lending company (now Ameris Bank Equipment Finance after 2021 acquisition), providing working capital loans, equipment financing, and SBA loans to small and mid-sized businesses nationwide.

leaders.bg: Leads Balboa Capital's operations as CEO and President under the Ameris Bank umbrella.
Oversees financial operations for Balboa Capital's equipment finance and small business lending divisions.

name: ClickLease, LLC
desc: Fintech company providing instant micro-ticket equipment leasing solutions, founded in 2018 by Snap Finance co-founder Bart Longson, using technology-driven instant pre-qualification for commercial equipment purchases.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Snap Finance before founding Clicklease in 2018; 20+ years in homebuilding and private lending.
Leads operations and growth strategy for Clicklease's technology-driven equipment leasing platform.

name: TimePayment Corp.
desc: Boston-based fintech equipment leasing company owned by Fortress Investment Group, providing fast, paperless lease financing through technology tools for equipment sellers and financial intermediaries.

leaders.bg: Joined TimePayment in 2018 as COO as part of succession plan; led record growth and technology enhancements before becoming CEO.

leaders.t: VP, Point of Sale & Terminal Leasing
leaders.bg: Appointed in 2025 to lead the firm's expanding POS and terminal leasing business unit.

name: Mundi Trade, Inc.
desc: Fintech platform providing cross-border trade finance, currency exchange, and risk management services for SMEs, founded in 2020 with $38.8M in funding and headquarters in New York.

leaders.bg: Originally from Argentina with an MBA from Stanford; previously entrepreneur-in-residence at FJ Labs in New York.
Co-founded Mundi to simplify cross-border trade for underserved SMEs.

name: Quantum Lending
desc: AI-driven SMB lending platform formed through the merger of Fundation, Camino Financial, and Amount's SMB operations, recently securing $400M in debt and equity financing to power its AI lending platform.

leaders.bg: Partner at LL Funds; serves as equity investor and Chairman guiding Quantum's vision and AI-era transformation.

name: David Allen Capital, Inc.
desc: Small business capital agent and ISO based in Michigan, providing merchant cash advances, business lines of credit, equipment financing, and payment processing services through a large network of independent sales agents.

leaders.bg: Leads David Allen Capital; background includes roles at ACN, General Motors, and Accenture.

name: Marco
desc: Full-stack fintech platform providing trade finance solutions (factoring, ABL, purchase order financing, supply chain finance) to underserved companies in Latin America and the US, with offices in Miami, New York, and Montevideo.

leaders.bg: Handles fundraising, talent development, and organizational continuity for Marco's trade finance platform.
Manages day-to-day business development and operations across Marco's multi-country platform.
Previously director of engineering at Ripple Labs; now leads Marco's technology and platform development.

name: North Mill Equipment Finance LLC
desc: Flexible equipment financing company based in Connecticut, recognized for industry-leading culture and technology transformation, with recent investments in CTO leadership and team promotions to drive growth.

leaders.bg: Led NMEF's cultural transformation over the past six years alongside President Mark Bonanno.
Co-leads NMEF's operations and culture transformation with CEO David Lee.
Appointed September 2025; nearly 20 years driving technology transformation in asset-backed finance and private credit.

name: inKind
desc: Restaurant-focused fintech providing upfront capital to independent restaurants in exchange for future dining credits, with a consumer app connecting 4M+ users to 6,000+ restaurant partners and over $600M deployed.

leaders.bg: Founded inKind with his husband Andrew Harris; recently raised $450M from Magnetar and Jay-Z's MarcyPen; ranked No. 40 on Financial Times Fastest-Growing list.
Leads technology development for inKind's restaurant financing and consumer dining platform.
Co-founder focused on sustainable and equitable restaurant funding practices.

name: Raistone
desc: World's largest B2B embedded finance provider, transforming access to working capital through supply chain finance, invoice factoring, and accelerated payment solutions, with $10B+ in financing and six consecutive years of double Y/Y growth.

leaders.bg: 20+ years building and operating fintechs; named Supply Chain Finance CEO of the Year and recognized as Tech Leader by PayTech Awards.

name: Kabbage
desc: Small business lending platform acquired by American Express in 2020, now operating as American Express Business Blueprint offering business lines of credit, cash flow management tools, and working capital to small businesses.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Kabbage and led its integration into American Express as Business Blueprint before the brand was retired.
Co-founded Kabbage and helped build it into a leading alternative small business lender before the AmEx acquisition.

name: Aspiria
desc: Mexican fintech providing digital short-term lines of credit to small and medium businesses, using proprietary statistical credit scoring models and fully digital lending operations, serving 1,300+ clients nationwide.

leaders.bg: Founded Aspiria to bring change to the SME financing space in Mexico, developing proprietary credit scoring models.
Co-developed Aspiria's business model, statistical credit scoring, and digital lending technology from a garage startup.

name: Capchase
desc: Series B fintech providing revenue-based financing and working capital solutions for SaaS businesses, with nearly $1B raised in funding, a partnership with Stripe as their first B2B BNPL payment method, and EUR 105M credit facility from Deutsche Bank.

leaders.bg: Harvard Business School grad; previously led growth at Geoblink, a location intelligence company based in Madrid.
Technical co-founder driving Capchase's revenue-based financing platform development.
Co-founded Capchase in 2020 to help SaaS companies access non-dilutive capital.

name: Whetstone Holdings
desc: Alternative funding company based in Miami operating Granite Merchant Funding (revenue-based financing $750K-$2M) and Aspen Invoice Factoring, led by founder Laurie Whetstone with focus on serving established business owners.

leaders.bg: Over two decades of board and executive leadership experience; sought-after advisor and consultant to nonprofit, private, and public companies.

name: IOU Financial
desc: Small business lender based in Georgia, operating since 2009 with $1.5B+ in loans facilitated, recently rebranded with a redesigned website and new application experience enabling pre-approvals in minutes.

leaders.bg: Co-founded IOU Financial in 2008; 25+ years in financial services including senior roles in wholesale mortgage lending originating $4.5B+ annually.
